It returns a list with a single empty string, instead of context containers.

       ProjectContainerProxy pcProxy = ProjectContainerProxy.getInstance();
       List pcs = pcProxy.listOpenContainersWithRepository(project.getName());
       for (Iterator iter = pcs.iterator(); iter.hasNext();) {
>>>            ContextContainer container = (ContextContainer) iter.next();
           if (container instanceof ProjectContextContainer) {
               pc = (ProjectContextContainer)container;
               break;
           }
       }

The problem prevents collaboration events to be generated.

listOpenContainersWithRepository should return a list of Uri Strings not the actual ContextContainers since this function is executed on the server side and every matching ContextContainer would have been returned from server to client.  If the actual COntextContainer is needed use the uri and openContainer.
